author: BlueGalaxy47
title: Does The Job Well
review:
I bought two of these baseplates as a base for my Lego City. They support my city well and bricks click securely into place onto the baseplate. The colour is good and the size is practical for me.

The price is a bit on the high side; you only get one piece per set!

author: Hashem1983
title: Not Bad, but Not as GOOD as the Old ones..
review:
I bought the baseplate from "Toys R Us", I got to say for its price its quite expensive, and when I got home, some how, I got a bit disappointed when I removed the seal out of it, the quality of the Baseplate is not as the same as the old ones, even the green color, you feel that there is a yellowish shade in it, even though my old baseplates are more than 20 years old, still the green color looks better, however, the bricks locks on it perfectly.

If you want to buy these baseplates, just make sure you don't mix it with the old ones, if you have, other than that its good for building, but the price should be cheaper.

author: StevenTheBrick
title: Green Baseplate
review:
2/5

 

There is no building experience, what you get is what you get. The plate however is an amazing piece and provides usefulness for display or playability. The value is good at $8.

author: StarKiller22515
title: The perfect thing for a builders creative mind
review: This is the perfect thing to get someone who is very creative but has no base to build on and they re restricted to building on smaller plates. You really cant go wrong getting this for someone who owns LEGO. Buy it for just about anyone. You can just stand your minifigures on it if you want to. The possiblilities are endless.
